item.title: Overview
item.description: Aside from the firmware, the application consists of 3 parts: flowcontrol flowcontrol-monitor flowcontrol-cli flowcontrol and flowcontrol-cli are currently independent, I’m looking to consolidate their codebase now they’re both using Go and utilise shared packages for stuff like serial communication. flowcontrol This is the GUI application. It’s built using wails flowcontrol-monitor This is the supplementary application to the main one. It provides system metrics such as GPU Clock and temperatures using LibreHardwareMonitorLib.

item.title: Desktop App
item.description: Prerequisites Go 1.12+ npm net5 SDK (Optional, only required if you’re using the monitor) Linux gcc, gtk, webkitgtk Running Locally flowcontrol cd src/flowcontrol/ wails serve cd src/flowcontrol/frontend npm run serve flowcontrol-monitor cd src/flowcontrol-monitor/ dotnet run

item.title: Requirements
item.description: Parts List Here’s a list of parts you’ll need if you’d like to build the hardware yourself: USB to UART module Raspberry Pi Pico x2 4-Pin PWM Fan Connector Male x2 10k Resistors x2 Female and Male JST Connectors (For temp sensors, optional) If you can solder SMD, there’s a PCB available. These may be available pre-soldered in the future.

item.title: Running Locally
item.description: Prerequisites Go 1.12+ Running Locally flowcontrol-cli cd src/flowcontrol-cli/ go install flowctl
